alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 12 at 4:13PM MST until August 12 at 7:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Yavapai County south of Wagoner in west central Arizona... * Until 715 PM MST. * At 411 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in south central Yavapai County over the Castle Creek and Hassayampa River basins south of Wagoner and just north of Castle Hot Springs. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Castle Hot Springs and Lake Pleasant. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Castle Creek, Humbug Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Hamlin Wash, Bitter Creek, Ash Creek, Buckhorn Creek, Hassayampa River, Agua Fria River, Black Butte Wash, French Creek, Amazon Gulch and Whipsaw Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
